case_vignette: A 75-year-old male presents with a few day history of blisters developing on his arms and legs. He denies any exposures to poison ivy, any recent travel, and any recent medication changes. Physical examination demonstrates thin urticarial pink plaques on the abdomen and multiple tense bullae without significant underlying erythema scattered on the arms and legs.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been getting these blisters on my arms and legs over the past few days.
Have you noticed any itching or burning before the blisters appeared?
No, I haven't felt any itching or burning.
Have you been exposed to any new substances or environments recently?
No, I haven't been exposed to anything new like poison ivy, haven't traveled recently, and haven't changed any of my medicines.
Have you had any recent injuries or cuts on your arms and legs?
No, I haven't had any injuries or cuts on my arms and legs.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as fever, fatigue, or joint pain?
No, I haven't noticed any other symptoms like fever, fatigue, or joint pain.
Have you had any skin conditions in the past?
I haven't mentioned any past skin conditions.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin color or texture?
Yes, I have thin pink spots on my belly and the blisters on my arms and legs are quite firm.
Final Diagnosis: Eczema.
